title.narrative: CRTA: stöd till civilsamhället för att främja demokrati och EU-integrering
CRTA: support to CSOs to promote democracy and EU integration

description.narrative: Denna insats kommer skapa gynnsamma förutsättningar för och säkerställa utrymme för fortsatt utveckling och demokratisering genom stöd till kampanjer inom civilsamhället som berör huvudområdena i Serbiens EU-integrationsprocess: rättsväsende, demokratisk kultur och mediefrihet. Med hjälp av kommunikationsfärdigheter, kapacitet, kanaler och digitala verktyg kommer civilsamhället (organisationer och journalister) få möjligheten att engagera medborgare på mer effektivt sätt. Detta kommer också bidra till en förbättring av dialogen mellan medborgare och regeringen, samt återställa medborgarns tillit och tilltro till samhälleliga institutioner. Dessutom kommer en ökad medvetenhet om civilsamhällets insatser för stärkt demokratisering även leda till en större tillit till civilsamhällets roll som en viktig aktör för demokratisk utveckling.

This intervention will generate domestic force that will safeguard the space for further development and democratisation, by supporting civil society campaigns in areas of the primary importance for Serbia’s EU integrations: rule of law, democratic culture and media freedoms. Equipped with communication skills, capacities, channels and digital tools, civil society partners (CSOs, grassroots and journalists) will be able to engage citizens more deeply and reach their communication and advocacy goals more effectively. Civil society development will also ensure the adequate civic response in addressing gaps between citizens and governments, thus restoring the public confidence and trust in institutions. By raising awareness of civil society partners’ democratisation efforts, this intervention will help improve the general level of trust towards the civil society sector as generator of democratic development, and will raise citizens’ awareness of benefits of democratization and EU integration process.

description.narrative: The submitted narrative reporting has been delivered on time and is complete in terms of fulfilling conditions in the Agreement. CRTA submits on 2020-04-30 the Annual Narrative Report including RAF and Risks follow ups. Audit excresise has been postponed due to Corona circumstances and temporary measures of restricted movement. Embassy and partners work from home while declared state of emergency (since 2020-03-16). The audited financial report is expected in May 2020. The Narrative Report provides information that enables Sida to assess the achievement of results and shows that the partner applies Results Based Management (RBM). The 2019 was marked by further polarisation in the Serbian society, and many breaches of accountability and performance of democratic institutions and processes. This all undermines the rule of law, democratic culture and media freedoms. There is a complete dominance of one political party, there is a lack of pluralistic public debate, and there is a parliamentary and electoral boycott from the side of the opposition. The widespread media censorship and disinformation prevail, and such an unfavorable environment additionally restricts opportunities for civil society and citizens’ active and effective democratic participation. The programme invested additional efforts in this period to reinvigorate the interest, motivation and potential for broad citizen effort in defending and demanding democracy. The programme provided support to a total of 22 local civil society organisations under the second year’s Communications Development Support Programme:14 organisations receiving full (capacity building, technical and financial) programme support , and 8 organisations receiving solely capacity building and technical programme support. Some exaples of the programme results in 2019 in relation to programme partners: - 100% increase in the number of listeners of the supported Radio Centrala talk show of the Effective Mobilization of Communities from Užice; - Attracted 90% of new visitors through the supported Renewables and Environmental Regulatory Institute from Belgrade website; - Increased monthly interactions at social networks of the Center for Judicial Research from Belgrade by over 80%; - More than 50 media reports in national and local online media about the supported Res Publica from Kragujevac and its efforts; The achieved results relate to direct support to organisations but also to networking, building coallitions and joint actions. One example is that CRTA launched the first Festival of Democracy in Serbia in 2019. as an innovative format to boost optimism and reinforce trust in democracy. Organized are 43 public events in 18 towns under the Democracy Festival umbrella, in cooperation with local partner civil society organisations. There were a few thousands of direct participants at the Democracy Festival events, and a total of 84 media reports covering and reporting on the Democracy Festival events. Democracy Festival online campaign reached nearly 350.000 users, with 202.102 impressions on Facebook and 135.194 impressions on Twitter. CRTA displays ability to collect and learn from results information and to adapt to the context, which is important for their capacity to apply RBM. One example is that based on experiences from the first programme year, CRTA in 2019 developed a more comprehensive communications capacity building support, tailored to the partners’ specific capacity development needs and areas of work. This approach was applied across different levels of support within the Programme (training, technical and grant support) and it significantly raised the potential and influence of civil society on targeted issues in areas of the rule of law, democratic culture and media freedoms. The Communications Hub established under the programme aims for enhancement of supported organisations’ outreach and communication potential and effect. The Communication Hub in 2019 supported: 11 web portals, 8 online campaigns, 1 public opinion poll, 6 events with media representatives, 9 communication strategies, including both online and offline strategic communication and outreach, 1 documentary film,2 online games, 82 promotional and educational videos, 26 informative videos in the form of interviews, reportage and media coverage on the local issues. The programme developed a total of eight documentaries focusing on generation of the first-time voters who will be allowed to vote in the upcoming parliamentary elections. CRTA conducted the qualitative research in a form of focus groups with citizens that were organised during July and August 2019 in Belgrade. The main purpose of the qualitative research through focus groups discussions was to gain deeper insights and understanding of perceptions, stands and level of knowledge within the target group about the functional democracy, key threats to democracy, core democratic institutions, as well as of the types of motivation, either positive or negative, that would be able to prompt citizens’ more active engagement in defending democracy. Focus groups discussions were organised within four targeted population groups, each including eight participants, equal in gender, and divided by age groups in ranges 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 30-45. Focus groups included participants of high school and university level education and employed in both public and private sector, except the youngest group where students as well participated in the discussion. The key criteria for all participants included their preference towards democracy as the best political system for Serbia. This process enabled CRTA to precisely define the main target groups to address. Many public polls have shown that most of the Serbian citizens (above 50%) claim that democracy is their preferred system. However, the stable trend of decreasing civic engagement, accompanied by the rising number of passivized citizens and widespread political apathy was evident. From CRTA’s perspective, that was an alarming issue that CRTA decided to address with the campaign with the key message being that democracy can’t be sustained without active and conscious citizens. In 2019. CRTA also conducted an internal assessment among its teams and staff members, to identify needs and potentials for further communications growth, which resulted in the detailed training plan for CRTA team members, that was used as a framework for organization of internal trainings in the previous period. The Embassy maintains close contact and follow up with the CRTA, and we have developed good working relations. The CRTA seem as reliable partner, they also provide Embassy with their research and analytical data on the overall context or its specific areas ofrelevance and/or interest, and maintain good communication and cooperation with the Embassy Political Section. Based on the information from the Embassy regular follow up (including the Controller involvement in the follow ups) and based on the information from reports and discussions with CRTA and other stakeholders , the programme maintains potential to deliver results.
